Posts.Content: Hi Ann, had a bit of a meltdown yesterday but feeling better today. Hope you're feeling ok.  Before I opted for the mastectomy, the Dr said he was going to perform a lumpectomy & then radiotherapy, so I'm gathering this is why I'm not having immediate reconstruction. I have a tumour as well as the calcification. Holding onto the hope that the first time they looked at the lymphs they looked normal & second time they looked they said they were very slightly thickened, which they said may have been due to the biopsy the week before.  I am slightly worried how I'll look after as I'm like you a D-E cup, so an ample pair And same, hate the loss of control also, I am rarely ever poorly, so this has hit me for six!  Please let me know how you get on & good luck.  Carlie xx

Posts.Content: Hi Ann, I have been ok, how are you feeling?  The nurse is coming to my home tomorrow to discuss my feelings etc & talk about the op next week. I haven't really had much info, I found out only 2 weeks ago that I had bc & the week after was the info gathering. Had a brief meeting with the Dr last Thursday where he told me there was a large area of calcification - biopsy was inconclusive which is why I opted for the mastectomy. I have waited 4 months to be seen, my GP, put on the referral form 'not suspected cancer' which put me to the back of the queue. Can't believe any GP would not take a lump seriously which makes me angry.  I'm glad to hear the good news that your bone density is above average, these bits of positive news bring some hope in this rubbish situation we're in xx What is the before photo shoot? Is it something you would arrange yourself?  Oh yes the waiting makes me so anxious & on edge & I have to mentally prepare for the news!  I know, I want it over with now too although I am scared stiff. How are you feeling about it all?  Carlie xxx
